deck: Nimble Jack is a creepy, quirky, ghoulish figure. His feeding on insanity would go unchecked if it wasn't for Colder's Declan Thomas.
description:
Origin

Nimble Jack is a strange person that cannot be seen by everybody else but crazy people only. Nimble feeds on (dead) people's souls and when he does so he devours their minds entirely and he considers insane people the tastiest, the ones with the most flavor. Crazy people, when alive, are the most colorful to Nimble. Besides feeding on insanity, Nimble can also cure and worsen crazy people but unlike Declan Thomas, this lets Nimble become even stronger and does not weaken his body's condition. However, Nimble does not seem to be a real person in the first place.

Creation

Nimble Jack was created by Paul Tobin and Juan Ferreyra, and first appeared in Colder #1; published by Dark Horse Comics in 2012.

Character Evolution

A long time ago, in 1941, Nimble Jack let Declan Thomas go and escape the great fire that destroyed the Sansid Asylym for the Criminally Insane in Barnstable, Massachusetts, in 1941. According to Declan, Nimble must have decided to let Declan go back then, because Declan is a special kind of insanity, the finest brew that grows even richer with age like good wine, and Nimble likes to play with his food.
 
When Declan decides to start talking again in present day Boston, and even shows the Hunger World to Reece Talbot, he opens a door for Nimble who immediately starts chasing and playing with his favorite food. When Reece starts believing she may be the crazy one, Nimble becomes attracted to her, too.
name: Nimble Jack

deck: Possessed by five literary ghosts, Fabian Gray is able to utilize each of their unique abilities.
description:
Creation

Fabian Gray was created by writer Frank J. Barbiere and artist Chris Mooneyham in 2012 when they started Five Ghosts as a Kickstarter Project.

Origin

Fabian Gray and his twin sister, Sylvia, grew up on the streets stealing what they needed to survive. Tired of thieving Fabian began his search for an artifact known as the Dreamstone. When he finally found it he urged his reluctant sister to read a spell that would supposedly activate it's powers.

In a tragic accident Fabian becomes possessed by five literary ghosts and his sister's ghost is, supposedly, pulled into The Dreaming. Wanting to free his sister and make up for his mistakes, he searches for another Dreamstone to rescue her.

Powers and Abilities

Treasure Hunter - Fabian is a treasure hunter with some minor skill in theft, and some knowledge of archaeology and the occult (as related to tracking down Dreamstones and their legends).

Dreamstone Powers - His body is fused with shards of Dreamstone, which allows him to call upon literary "spirits" which lend their talents and powers to him. This includes:

  • The Archer - Gives him superb skill with a bow and arrows and thrown weapons. As such, he is armed with a bow and arrow as standard equipment.
  • The Wizard - Grants the use of elemental spells, such as summoning giant hands of rock from the ground, throwing fireballs, creating light.
  • The Detective - Grants him uncanny awareness of his surroundings and quick deductive skills. This is often used in combat, enabling him to improvise tactics utilizing the environment, or for searching for clues during his excursions.
  • The Samurai - Grants him superb swordsmanship. As such, he is also armed with a katana as standard equipment.
  • The Vampire - Grants him vampire powers, including above-human strength, agility, and speed, razor sharp claws and fangs, enhanced senses, and a near-bestial savagery in combat.

deck: Brin is a long-lived wanderer, travelling the world of Talamander.
description:
Created by Tim Brown, Brin appears in the Talamander and Brin series.

Who is Brin?

Living from hand to mouth, owning nothing but the clothes on his back, some may call him a vagrant, but not to his face!

As a long-lived, Brin is stronger than your average human, he also has more years than 'three score and ten' (thirty score would probably cover it).

Brin travels the world of Talamander, never settling in one place for long, looking for excitement and adventure, avoiding boredom at all costs.

Unfortunately Brin has a leaning towards obsessive compulsive behaviour, resulting in diversions from his travelling (just don't ask him about the 'grains of sand counting' desert incident). Brin's OCD has got him in to trouble on more than one occasion.

The early years

Originally the lead character in 'Something Bizarre' (of which only one issue was published in 1993), Brin spun-off into his own series 'The Adventures of Brin' in 1994. Many series followed, before coming to a conclusion 17 years later in Brin issue 24 in September 2010.

Now

Following a brief hiatus, Brin returned in all-new adventures with a fresh start and a new home in the 2012 series Talamander - free to read at www.talamander.com
name: Brin

deck: Victorian era skinflint.
description:
Origin

Jasper McGrab was nicknamed Jasper the Grasper by the other residents of Cortown because of his miserly, money-grabbing ways. He lived in 13 Stingy Street, a house he had festooned with ear trumpets to help him hear the sound of money being dropped from miles away, and, capable of identifying both the type of coin and roughly where it had been dropped just from the sound, Jasper would shoot forth from his home at supersonic speed to lay claim to it. Forever looking for ways to avoid spending money while simultaneously increasing his horde, Jasper undertook scheme after scheme, frequently illegal, almost always underhanded, in his pursuit of wealth, but karma tended to intervene, with Jasper losing out due to his own nastiness.

Creation

Jasper the Grasper was created by Ken Reid, and initially appeared in Wham! from issue 42 through 47. Though his run there was short, the character was revived for Cor!!, initially in a reprint of the Reid stories in Cor!! Annual 1972 (released late 1971) to introduce Cor!! readers to the character, and then by Trevor Metcalfe for all new stories from Cor!! issue 83, dated January 1st 1972. He continued to appear in Cor!! until that title's penultimate issue.
name: Jasper the Grasper

deck: Poor kid frequently tormented by his rich neighbour, Ivor Lott.
description:
Origin

Tony Broke was a poor boy who lived with his parents in Broke Cottage, a small run-down hovel neighbouring the vast Lott Hall, home of Ivor Lott and his father. Ivor loved showing off his wealth to Tony and mocking Tony's impoverished circumstances, but inevitably Ivor's nastiness backfired, leaving him the losing party in whatever situation the pair were in.

Creation

Tony Broke and Ivor Lott were created by Reg Parlett, and debuted in Cor!! issue 1 in 1970, with Tony's name coming from the phrase "Stony broke." The pair survived Cor!!'s cancellation and merger into Buster, proving enduringly popular with the readers. With British comics being mostly weekly anthologies the demand for new strips was constant, and thus British comics were never afraid to rip off the concepts of successful strips appearing in other comics; thus Buster's IPC stablemate Jackpot produced Millie O'Naire and Penny Less (the former a name already used as one of the Toffs from Knockout's The Toffs and the Toughs, a group version of the rich vs. poor class war seen between Tony and Ivor). When Jackpot also merged into Buster, Millie and Penny's strip merged into Ivor and Tony's, with the girls dating the respective boys. Millie and Penny eventually vanished from the strip, but Ivor and Tony continued appearing in Buster right until the final issue in 2000, a respectable thirty year run for their strip. The pair were namechecked in Albion, where it was revealed that Ivor had grown up to become a "Turf Accountant" (a betting shop owner).
name: Tony Broke

Ivor Lott lived in the vast Lott Hall with his father ("Pater"), next door to Broke Cottage, a small run-down hovel that was the home of the poor Tony Broke. Ivor loved showing off his wealth to Tony and mocking Tony's impoverished circumstances, but inevitably Ivor's nastiness backfired, leaving him the losing party in whatever situation the pair were in.

Creation

Tony Broke and Ivor Lott were created by Reg Parlett, and debuted in Cor!! issue 1 in 1970, with Ivor's name coming from "I've a lot". The pair survived Cor!!'s cancellation and merger into Buster, proving enduringly popular with the readers. With British comics being mostly weekly anthologies the demand for new strips was constant, and thus British comics were never afraid to rip off the concepts of successful strips appearing in other comics; thus Buster's IPC stablemate Jackpot produced Millie O'Naire and Penny Less (the former a name already used as one of the Toffs from Knockout's The Toffs and the Toughs, a group version of the rich vs. poor class war seen between Tony and Ivor). When Jackpot also merged into Buster, Millie and Penny's strip merged into Ivor and Tony's, with the girls dating the respective boys. Millie and Penny eventually vanished from the strip, but Ivor and Tony continued appearing in Buster right until the final issue in 2000, a respectable thirty year run for their strip. The pair were namechecked in Albion, where it was revealed that Ivor had grown up to become a "Turf Accountant" (a betting shop owner).
name: Ivor Lott

deck: The legendary Super Saiyan, possessing vast, near unlimited ki power. One of the strongest and also one of the surviving members of the Saiyan race. A recurring enemy in Dragon Ball Z movies.
description:
Origin

Broly is the son of a low-class Saiyan named Paragus. At birth, Broly was placed in a crib next to Son Goku, who was born the same day. For some strange reason the cries of Kakarot Broly caused in a number of disorders, from apparent rejection or discomfort, which inadvertently increased his power level, reaching 10,000. King Vegeta, fearing that his strength grew more as he grows up and rebels against him, ordered to execute Broly and his father, Paragus. Believing them dead, threw their bodies in a junkyard in planet Vegeta.

The destruction of Planet Vegeta at the hands of Frieza caused the destruction of almost the entire, Saiyan race and dispersion throughout the universe of the remaining survivors survivors, precisely, Broly was one of them, and still just a baby was able to save his father and take him to another planet acting unconsciously. His father, Paragus, was caring and raising him, trying to contain the immense power dormant within him, which even allowed him to become Super Saiyan since childhood. But it was useless once he grew, Broly was uncontrollable, his strength was far superior to that of his father and he was devoted to destroy every planet he found on his way.

Major Story Arcs

In New Vegeta

After the destruction of Frieza and Cooler, Paragus devised a plan that would lead to the planet Earth saiyans New Vegeta: Vegeta call (which eventually accompany all other Z warriors) to hold the title of king of the Saiyans and recover the splendor of the race on the grounds that there was a mighty warrior of the space that was previously removed. After achieving this, keep looking for that warrior entertained until the comet will collide with the planet Moori killing them on the spot. But things were not going to come out as he intended, once there, in the presence of Goku, Broly explodes unleashing none-stop his never-ending power (he grows over 5 feet and gains vast muscle mass, his pupils disappear and he gains the famous super Saiyan characteristics, although his hair is green-ish) and making a futile effort to stop his father, anulating for first time the power inhibitor headband and losing all self-awareness.

With his power in legendary Super Saiyan state, Broly killed his father throwing him to the comet Moori, as he tried to leave it in a space capsule, and was to easly defeat,and almost kill, Goku, Vegeta, Trunks, Piccolo and Gohan without even a wound. His power was so superior that it seemed that all was lost. Fortunately for the Saiyans, Goku managed to gather all the power of his comrades dying, the planet itself and his own in one punch and accurate apparently killed Broly.

Second Coming

Despise of what happened in New Vegeta, Broly survived the hit.Badly wounded,he found a damaged Saiyan space capsule,which he used to escape the collision of the comet. Traveling in space aimlessly, the capsule landed in a hazardous way in earth, forming a lake which later would freeze along with the mighty warrior. Seven years passed in which nothing disturbed his slumber, until finally awakened by the screams and cries of Son Goten, who he mistook with Goku.

This caused the immediate wake of the immense power of Broly. While as a super Saiyan, he was playing with Trunks and Son Goten, whose attacks were useless against his power. Only the transformation of Gohan in Super Saiyan (as Broly, after surviving the battle against Goku, suffered a Zenkai power incredibly increasing his power), could contain minimally Broly in Legendary Super Saiyan status, which would last few minutes. Gohan with his brutal attack had released a stream of lava,in which Broly got caught. At this time, Gohan becomes unconscious but before falling into the lava, Krillin, dressed in the costume of Picollo, saves his life. Seemingly defeated, Broly reappears to the bewilderment of Krillin and Gohan. Broly, ready to end the fighting, launched his Giant Meteor, which if had impacted on Earth would had destroyed it. However, both Gohan and Goten were ready to stop the attack throwing a Kame Hame Ha to repel the attack, which was not entirely effective.

The Omega Blaster Broly threw was gaining ground and the Earth was in danger. It was then, with the help of Shenron, Goku appeared ,a silhouette transformed into Super Saiyan to help their children. But even a Kame Hame Ha with three persons wasnt enough to overcome the power of Broly. Again, fortune sided with the saiyans, who received unexpected help from Trunks, who was dying. In a last effort, before passing the young descendant of Vegeta, threw a small ball of energy that exploded after colliding with one of the balls that Broly launched to further empower his blast, preventing it from receiving more energy from the legendary super saiyan. It was at that moment when Gohan, Goten and Goku (Goku is not clear whether it was an apparition or an illusion because they could never make a wish to Shenron) managed to defeat Broly, which created a barrier that allowed him to escape the attack But the momentum of the attack led him to the Sun On this occasion, Broly definitely die, but his blood cells that were in the ship they had come to the land would be used by a magician nearby in village to create a new and terrible being: Bio-Broly.

Powers and Abilities

As a member of the Saiyan race, Broly possesses all the powers inherent to his race. He is super-humanly strong and durable, and possesses enhanced speed and reflexes. He can undergo powerful Saiyan transformations, more powerful forms of his body, and is known to be the Legendary Super Saiyan,gaining vast muscle mass and strength, His power is continually growing, and has no set power level the only time he got his ki measured,it reached above 1,400,000,000 in Movie 8, and that's not including Movie 10 regardless it is one of the highest power levels,and that was just in his second form,meaning his powers when transforming to Legendary Super Saiyan 3, and 4 is far beyond that. He can generate energy blasts from ki, but in a different way than must of the other Saiyans,his blasts are in form of green barrier blasts that implode. He is capable of unaided flight and can survive in space by making a force field,the force field proved to be strong enough to take a energy blast with the power of 3 persons. Despite his size, Broly has proven numerous times to outspeed Goku and the others. Broly wiped out a galaxy while being controlled by his father Paragus in his Restrained Super Saiyan form (RSSJ). It's speculated that Broly destroyed the galaxy.
name: Broly

deck: Elephant editor of half of Shiver and Shake.
description:
Origin

Shake is an anthropomorphic elephant who enjoyed a variety of misadventures in the comic Shiver and Shake, where he also served as editor to the Shake half of the comic.

Creation

Portrayed as one of the comic's two editors, Shake debuted in the first issue of Shiver and Shake. The comic's title was apparently inspired by a strip of the same name which had previously appeared in Cor!!, and the other editor, Shiver, had previously starred in that Cor!! strip as one half of a ghostly duo whose names provided the strip's title- confusingly however, in the Cor!! strip, the rotund ghost Shiver had been called Shake, with the other ghost being Shiver.

issue_credits.name: Double the Fun... Two Books in One

name: Shake

volume_credits.name: Shiver and Shake Christmas Holiday Special

deck: Ghostly editor of the spooky half of Shiver and Shake.
description:
Origin

Shiver, formerly known as Shake, is a rotund, ever-hungry ghost who, outside of his haunting jobs, also serves as editor to one half of Shiver and Shake.

Creation

The corpulant ghost Shake was created by Arthur Martin and debuted in Cor!! issue 113, starring alongside the cavalier ghost Shiver in the strip Shiver and Shake. A month after Cor!! was cancelled and merged into Buster, Shake reappeared as the editor of new comic Shiver and Shake, now using his former co-star's moniker, and also starring in a new strip, The Duke's Spook. The strip continued until Shiver and Shake was merged into Whoopee!

Character Development

An overweight ghost who constantly obsessed about food, Shake shared an empty house with fellow spook Shiver. Both constantly hoped to have living people move in, but their differing reasons for this desire frequently brought them into conflict with one another - Shiver desired humans to scare, while Shake needed someone to supply the food he craved. Week after week new potential residents would visit the house, only for the clashing ghost's to unintentionally drive them away. Eventually, however, the house was demolished, and both ghosts moved on to new homes, in Shake's case the kitchen of an up-market restaurant.

Shake's tenancy there was apparently short lived. Cheekily appropriating the name of his former housemate, the newly retitled Shiver took up residence in a duke's mansion, while also ghosting (pun intended) as the editor for new magazine Shiver and Shake, alongside an elephant called (just to confuse matters further) Shake. Initially Shiver and the Duke got along swimingly, but when the Duke hired a new butler, Grimes, the secretly crooked servant and the resident ghost swiftly became unswerving enemies.

issue_credits.name: Double the Fun... Two Books in One

name: Shiver

volume_credits.name: Shiver and Shake Christmas Holiday Special

deck: A character in the series Zero Girl.
description:
Origin

Tim Foster is Amy's guidance counselor in the comic book series Zero Girl. He also features in the later title Zero Girl: Full Circle, which is set fifteen years after the events of the original series. In the latter, he also has a stepdaughter, named Nikki Foster.

Creation

Tim was created by Sam Kieth.

Character Development

Although ten years her senior, Amy develops an intense crush on Tim. In Zero Girl, he makes it clear to her that while he does care deeply for her, she is too young for him. Instead, he gives Amy his number, and tells her to give him a call when she turns eighteen. They meet up three years later, only to find that Tim is married, and Amy engaged.

When the two are reunited in Full Circle, Tim expresses hurt at being shut out of Amy's life for so long, after she confesses that she threw his phone number away, too embarrassed by his initial rejection to pursue him any further. The two are still in love, however, and attempt to rekindle their romance.
name: Tim Foster

deck: A character in the series Zero Girl: Full Circle.
description:
Origin

Nikki is the stepdaughter of Tim Foster.

Creation

Nikki was created by Sam Kieth.

Character Development

In a bizarre twist of fate, Nikki develops a crush on her school guidance counselor, Amy Smootster - just as Amy did with Nikki's father Tim, fifteen years before. But, unlike Zero Girl, Nikki's feelings are not entirely reciprocated, as Amy is still in love with Tim.
name: Nikki Foster

description:
Origin

Dyltah is the humanoid alien protagonist of the three-issue Helix series, Star Crossed.

Creation

Dyltah was created by Matt Howarth.

Character Evolution

Dyltah lives in space, somewhere between an asteroid belt and the planet Jupiter. She is deeply in love with a sentient asteroid named Saa. She is a loner, and frequently states that she hates people. It is later revealed that despite her outward appearance, Dyltah began life as a human, and underwent a series of expensive operations so that she could join the Jovian colony, and leave her own species behind. She also left behind a husband and son.

name: Saa

deck: A character from Optic Nerve.
description:
Origin

Martin Courtney is the protagonist in issue five of the Drawn & Quarterly series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Martin was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Martin Courtney is a writer who is stuck in a rut. Following the unexpected success of his semi-autobiographical first novel, Martin struggles to write, feeling pressured to equal - or even best - the sales and acclaim of his previous work. In the meantime, he makes a living writing articles, and ghost writing for celebrities. After receiving a postcard from his high school crush, Samantha Kinzel, Martin decides to take a trip to Sacramento, to find her. He goes to her old house, only to discover that she has left town and is unreachable. Martin immediately hits it off with the girl's teenaged sister, Jenna Hayden, who is a big fan of his work.

As work on his next novel grinds to a halt, Martin begins to spend more and more time with the young girl, and the two bond quickly, despite Martin already having a girlfriend at home. Eventually, the age difference between them becomes apparent, and her immaturity begins to irritate him. While he boasts otherwise to his best friend, the relationship is not physical in any sense, and when Jenna does eventually kiss him, he realises he is not even attracted to her. But it is too late, as his friend has already told Martin's partner everything, albeit the skewed, exaggerated version of events. She leaves him and, although he reluctantly breaks off all contact with Jenna, initially refuses to take him back.Typically for the Optic Nerve series, whether his later attempts to reconcile are successful or not is left unspecified. At the end of the story, he pitches a new idea to his publisher, his inspiration having finally returned.

Major Story Arcs

Martin does not appear in any major story arcs.

Powers And Abilities

Martin is a human character with no special powers or abilities.

Creation

Jenna was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Jenna is a teenager and high school student who lives in Sacramento. She has a sister, Samantha, who lives out of town. Jenna claims that the two very rarely speak to one another. She is a big fan of Martin Courtney, and meets him one day when he knocks on her door, looking for her sister. He tells Jenna that Samantha was his high school crush, she confesses to being a great admirer of his writing, and the two quickly become friends.

Jenna later tells Martin that her parents have divorced, and that her mother has a restraining order against her father. In spite of this, Jenna admits to having been to see him in secret.

From the start, it is clear that Jenna has a crush on Martin, and she tries constantly to impress him.

deck: A character from Optic Nerve.
description:
Origin

Hillary Chan is the protagonist of issue six of the Drawn & Quarterly series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Hillary was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

After living for years with overbearing parents, constantly in the shadow of her sister Grace, Hillary moves away from New Jersey and leaves her family behind. But things do not quite work out as planned. She gets a job in telesales, working for a catalog company, but is fired after a series of mistakes. Hillary is socially awkward, and is disappointed when she loses her job, as she finds it so much easier to communicate by phone. In person, she struggles to speak, becoming quiet and anxious - which people tend to mistake for sadness, or disinterest. She makes friends, but quickly grows apart from them. Eventually, she begins to sink into a depression. When a local radio station announces a competition to win a trip to Hawaii, Hillary begins to fantasise about escaping to a sun drenched paradise.

Hilary attempts to enter the competition, but when she is not the lucky caller, she ends up having a conversation off-air with the DJ, Johnny Angel. Johnny invites Hillary out for a drink, and she accepts. The two meet at a bar, and Hillary sees that Johnny is a sad, washed up, and bitter. He rants at Hilary about how he used to be popular, and moderately famous, but is now a has-been - making Hillary feel sympathetic toward him. She then performs a sexual act on him in his truck, and he promises to enter her into the prize draw for the trip to Hawaii. The two never speak again. Around this time her flatmate, Lloyd, moves out to live with his partner. While strictly friends, it is revealed that Hillary and Lloyd shared an intense, three day sexual encounter when she first moved in - only for Lloyd to back away, never again showing a romantic interest in her.

Just when Hillary believes her luck cannot get any worse, her parents call to inform her that her grandmother has died of a heart attack. Soon after, Hillary meets Sam while she is making prank phone calls. He becomes interested in her because he likes her voice, and when the prank she pulls on him falls flat, he tries to find out where she is. Hillary is reluctant at first, and tells him to call back another time. After their initial conversation, Sam returns to the pay phone where he spoke to Hillary, and attempts to speak to her again. This time, he tells her that if she does not reveal her location, her will hang up and walk away. He reasons that she has the advantage, since she already knows where he is. When she agrees, and tells Sam which window is hers, he invites her down for a drink - and she accepts. The couple end up going back to Sam's place and sleeping together, and after spending the night with each other, Hillary asks Sam if he will go with her to her grandmother's funeral - but whether he turns up or not is left in doubt. On the morning of her grandmother's funeral, at the end of her story, Hillary discovers that she did not win the holiday to Hawaii.

Major Story Arcs

Hillary does not appear in any major story arcs.

Powers And Abilities

Hillary is a human character with no special powers or abilities.

Carlos appears in issue seven of the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Carlos was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Carlos is a musician who moves into Vanessa's neighborhood. He is a womanizer who boasts of how easily he tires of women, and would struggle to sleep with the same woman more than ten times. While he likes to portray himself to others as a rock star, he is unsuccessful as a musician, and the only gigs he plays are at local pubs and bars.

Carlos meets Vanessa when she is out with a friend, looking for someone who has ID and can buy them alcohol. Seeing an opportunity, Carlos agrees, and invites the two teenage girls back to his home where he attempts to entice them into sleeping together. While her friend leaves, Vanessa chooses to stay, and begins an affair with him.

After their affair is discovered, Carlos is brutally attacked by Vanessa's boyfriend, Whit, and is hospitalized. Prior to the attack, Carlos tells Vanessa he is already beginning to tire of her - when she visits him in hospital to apologize, he breaks up with her, leaving her with nobody.

Major Story Arcs

Carlos does not appear in any major story arcs.

Carlos is a human character with no special powers or abilities.

Vanessa appears in issue seven of the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Vanessa was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Vanessa is a young, attractive girl who works part time at a greetings card outlet. She is pursued romantically by three different characters - Whit, Carlos and Neil. While in a relationship with Whit, Vanessa meets Carlos while out with a friend, and the two begin sleeping together. Vanessa does not feel bad about this - in fact, she explains to one of her friends that life is like a salad bar, that no one person is perfect and so a girl must mix and match when it comes to choosing lovers. She tells the same friend that she does not consider Carlos to be boyfriend material as he is too self obsessed, and that Whit seems like a decent person who knows how to treat her.

Although she is not initially aware of it, Neil has a dangerous obsession with her, and regularly finds reasons to visit her at work. It is Neil who reveals her affair to Whit, leading to a brutal, unexpected attack which leaves Carlos hosptalised. Vanessa goes to see him, intending to apologise, but he breaks up with her.

Major Story Arcs

Vanessa does not appear in any major story arcs.

Neil appears in issue seven of the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Neil was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Neil is a loner with voyeuristic tendencies. He is mentally and emotionally unstable, and regularly sees a psychiatrist. He has an unhealthy obsession with Vanessa and visits the card shop where she works frequently, finding excuses and inventing fictional birthdays to explain his need to buy so many greetings cards - which he keeps in a drawer at home, unsent.

Neil spends a lot of time watching his neighbours go about their business, and often spies on them during intimate moments. When he sees Vanessa cheating on her boyfriend with Carlos, Neil tips him off about it, leading to a brutal confrontation between the two men. The attack leaves Carlos hospitalized. After causing the breakdown of Vanessa and Whit's relationship, and the resultant violence, Neil is shown to be quite serene and content. Vanessa becomes increasingly hostile toward Neil, and tells him that she hates him - but no more than she hates everybody else.

Major Story Arcs

Neil does not appear in any major story arcs.

Neil is a human character with no special powers or abilities.

Cammie appears in issue eight of the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Cammie was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Cammie is a high school student and a friend of Scotty - the pair work together at the same diner after school. She is wilder and more adventurous than the other girls, who see her as a "slut". As a result, she does not have many friends. She fools around with Bryan, but comes to hate him after an ugly incident between the two teens at a house party. At the party, Cammie gets drunk, dancing on a table and flashing her underwear. She then passes out and defecates. When Bryan finds out, he carries her into the bathroom, removes her underwear, and cleans her up in the shower before making sure she gets medical attention. Cammie does not know this, and assumes it was Bryan who called the other guests over to look at her, half naked and passed out. This sours things between them, and Cammie is later humiliated in front of the other students when Bryan and his friends pelt her with toilet paper while she is giving a speech.

Cammie has a tough time at home and while she does not discuss this often, toward of the book she confides in Scotty that she, along with her mother and brother, may be moving to another town and leaving her father. She and Scotty have a typical teenage friendship, and while they tell each other secrets and have a lot of fun together, the two are also prone to bickering and sulking.

Major Story Arcs

Cammie does not appear in any major story arcs.

Powers And Abilities

Cammie is a human character with no special powers or abilities.

deck: Enemy of Captain Triumph. Initially worked in conjuction with his twin brother Z. Spade, but later returned to face Captain Triumph on his own.
description:
Twin brothers A. Spade and Z. Spade were unethical munitions dealers and saboteurs whose illegal activities were foiled by Captain Triumph.

After the brothers' arrest, A. Spade killed a guard and escaped from prison on the eve of his trial. He captured Captain Triumph's girlfriend Kim Meredith and brutally interrogated her in an attempt to learn Triumph's location, but she refused to talk despite the savage beating. Triumph managed to track down Spade and went to Spade's hideout, using his rarely-utilized illusory powers to disguise himself as Spade's cohort Carim Bombay. The disguised Triumph learned of Spade's plan to destroy several US defense plants with explosive capsules of Spade's own design. Triumph's "undercover" work was spoiled by the arrival of the real Bombay, who shot and killed Spade in order to carry out the plan and reap all the profits himself. Captain Triumph and his sidekick Biff Banks stopped the sabotage and rescued Kim, though Bombay escaped.

The Spade brothers were modeled after actor Sydney Greenstreet, while Carim Bombay was drawn to resemble Greenstreet's frequent co-star Peter Lorre.

Miko appears in issues 9 - 11 of the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Miko was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Miko is in a relationship with Ben Tanaka, and initially lives with him in Berkley, California. She leaves him when his obsession with white girls gets out of hand. Although he denies that it is a problem, Miko confronts him with pornography she has found hidden in his room, and tries to explain to Ben how insecure he is making her feel. The two agree to a trial separation, but after Miko is offered a place at a prestigious Asian-American Film Institute in New York, she decides to start afresh, and the two quickly grow apart as a result.

While Ben sees no problem with his own interracial preferences, Miko soon discovers when she begins dating a white man that these views are hypocritical. In stark contrast to Ben's superficial, physical compulsion toward white women, Miko's new partner goes to great lengths to understand her by learning the same language and studying her culture. Even so, Ben is outraged, and later claims that there is something wrong with any white man who has a specific preference for Asian women. Ben's argument falls apart when Miko points out that her new partner is not Caucasian at all - he is half Jewish, half Native American.

Miko struggles to make Ben recognise any kind of fault in himself. While she explains to him that she can no longer stand his constant negativity, Ben still insists that she is leaving him for someone else.

Major Story Arcs

The three issues featuring Miko were later collected into a single volume, Shortcomings.

Powers And Abilities

Miko is a human character with no special powers or abilities.
name: Miko Hayashi

deck: A character from Optic Nerve.
description:
Origin

Ben appears in the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Ben was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Ben is the protagonist of the three issue Optic Nerve story Shortcomings. He initially lives in Berkley, California with his girlfriend Miko Hayashi. His best friend is a lesbian named Alice Kim, and the two often call each other for advice in times of need. He has even posed as Alice's boyfriend to spare her embarrassment at family occasions, as her family are not aware that she is a lesbian. Ben has a sexual obsession with young, blonde Caucasian girls, and it eventually leads to the break up of his relationship with Miko. The pair initially agree to a trial separation, but after they begin seeing other people, Ben and Miko decide to break up for good.

While on a break from Miko, Alice takes Ben to a lesbian party where he meets Sasha, a young blonde student who is openly bisexual (or, as Alice describes her, a "fence-sitter"). The two enjoy a brief relationship, before Sasha leaves Ben for her ex girlfriend.

Ben almost gets involved with Autumn, a young musician and artist who is part of a performance art group. But he soon discovers that Autumn has a phobia of germs, and as a result does not like to kiss people.

When he discovers that Miko has begun dating a white man, Ben confronts the pair. Although he has no objection to his own pursuit of Caucasian women, his attitude to Miko's new relationship is hateful, and racist. His argument falls apart when Miko points out that her new partner is not Caucasian at all - he is half Jewish, half Native American. He later tells Alice and Meredith that he is deeply suspicious of white men who have a preference for Asian women. This leads to a heated drunken debate with Meredith, during which it becomes clear that the two are beginning to dislike each other. It is also later implied that he resents Meredith a little for taking up so much of Alice's time, especially when his best friend makes the decision to move away.

Another example of Ben's tendency toward double standards is his behavior in New York. After confronting Miko and her new partner in the street, Ben visits her at home, demanding answers. Here, he accuses Miko of cheating. Although he slept with numerous women during their separation, he perceives Miko responding in kind as some form of betrayal - even after she tells him that she only began dating again after one of her friends saw Ben with another woman.

Ben is deeply insecure, and confides in Alice that the real reason he prefers younger Caucasian girls because they "don't seem to mind about size so much". But when she quizzes him further about this, he becomes defensive, and changes the subject.

At the end of the story, Ben is forced to return to California empty handed and alone, since Alice has decided to remain in New York, and Miko is moving on with her life.

Major Story Arcs

Ben is the protagonist of the Optic Nerve story arc Shortcomings, the issues of which were later collected into a single volume of the same name.

Powers And Abilities

Ben is a human character with no special powers or abilities.
name: Ben Tanaka

Alice appears in issues 9 - 11 of the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Alice was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Alice is the best friend of Ben Tanaka. She and Ben are very close, and are a constant source of advice and support for one another, often calling each other for help at significant moments. She is not keen on Ben's partner Miko Hayashi, but this is partly because Ben is not always honest about their relationship, and as a result Alice's impression of Miko is far worse than the reality.

She is openly homosexual around her friends, and can often be seen hitting on women wherever she and Ben go. She even invites Ben to a lesbian party, where he meets his later lover, Sasha. But Alice keeps her sexuality hidden from her strict family, who would disapprove. She asks Ben to pose as her partner for family functions, to save the embarrassment of having to explain why she is still single. Alice eventually finds love, moving away from Ben to be with her partner, Meredith. She encourages Ben and Meredith to become friends, but the two are diametrically opposed in their views, and clash from the offset.

Major Story Arcs

Alice is a prominent character in the Optic Nerve story arc Shortcomings, the issues of which were later collected into a single volume of the same name.

Powers And Abilities

Alice is a human character with no special powers or abilities.

deck: Aerndis, the teacher.
description:
Origin

Aerndis the teacher is an ancient and hagged magic user, extremely mysterious she is sought out by the Lady Sif so that Sif may learn the berserker incantation.

Creation

Aerndis is a Marvel comics character created by Kathryn Immonen and Valerio Schiti. She first appears in Journey into Mystery #646, in the story "Stronger Than Monsters" released in 2013.

Character Evolution

Aerndis is a supporting character in the Journey into Mystery series, although so far she appears in both a neutral and antagonistic role.

Major Story Arcs

Stronger Than Monsters

The dragon Nidhogg has instructed Sif of Asgard if she wishes to know the Berserker Incarnation she must seek out Aerndis the Teacher. Sif travels past the Fimbulthul, and past the well Hvergelmir to enter the cave of Aerndis. Aerndis would appear before Sif, in a rush of green smoke and flame, and immediately judge Sif unworthy, striking proud Sif sending the Asgardian reeling. Sif would begin to explain herself before Aerndis speaking of her desire to learn the berserker incantation. Aerndis continues to resist Sif challenging her motivates and wishes, engaging in battle, grabbing Sif by her throat. Sif fights back and persists asserting her desire to become a better and stronger warrior. A fiercer warrior. Her attitude still that of mocking towards Sif, Aerndis would teach Sif the berserker incantation, but patronize her at the end. Sif would appear to lop her head off in an angry dazed blur. Carrying Aerndis head in a bag, it would eventually end up in the hands of Heimdall who would return it to Aerndis body, allowing Aerndis to act of her own accord, readjusted her head, demonstrating she was still alive.

Powers and Abilities

Presumably similar physical traits and powers typical of Asgardian heritage, Aerndis also appears to have great ancient knowledge and wisdom.
name: Aerndis

deck: A character from Optic Nerve.
description:
Origin

Autumn appears in the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Autumn was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Autumn works with Ben Tanaka, and the two are friends. She is also an artist and musician, and plays in a performance art troupe/punk band. She has a crippling phobia of germs, and cannot bear to kiss people, much to Ben's disappointment - the two go out together a few times, but the relationship doesn't last because of Autumn's unusual fear. One of Autumn's artistic projects involves her getting up every morning, going to the toilet, and taking a picture. She plans to do this for a year, and then use the results to create an artistic exhibition.

Major Story Arcs

Autumn is a minor character in the Optic Nerve story arc Shortcomings, the issues of which were later collected into a single volume of the same name.

Powers And Abilities

Autumn is a human character with no special powers or abilities.
name: Autumn

deck: A character from Optic Nerve.
description:
Origin

Sasha appears in the Drawn & Quarterly comic book series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Sasha was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Sasha is a bisexual student who has a brief relationship with Ben Tanaka. They meet when Alice Kim takes Ben to a lesbian party, but don't start dating until Ben runs into her at work later on. Alice warns Ben away from Sasha, and is against them dating from the very beginning. She eventually leaves him when her ex girlfriend Caitlin comes back to town.

Major Story Arcs

Sasha is a minor character in the Optic Nerve story arc Shortcomings, the issues of which were later collected into a single volume of the same name.

Powers And Abilities

Sasha is a human character with no special powers or abilities.
name: Sasha

name: Adrian Tomine

deck: A six-year old girl who was held hostage by Mama Sun and forced into sex labor on Sextillion. She was saved from captivity by "The Will", who later named her "Sophie."
description:
Origin

She hails from the comet Phang. Her brother was arrested for treason. Her uncle had to pay a fine to get her brother out, but he didn't have enough money. The Slave Girl was too little to work in the mines, so her uncle sold her into slavery. He was told the job would just be cleaning. Instead, she was sold to Sextillion, a hedonistic planet.

Creation

Slave Girl was created by Saga writer Brian K. Vaughan and artist Fiona Staples. Slave Girl's first appearance was in Image Comics' Saga #4.

Major Story Arcs

Slave Girl first appears on Sextillion where she is held as a prostitute. The Will soon kills her pimp and attempts to leave with her but is stopped by Mama Sun who owns the girl. She offers The Will to buy out Slave Girl for 650.000 - more then The Will's ship is worth.

Slave Girl next appears in The Will's weird dream that suddenly ends when Slave Girl mumbles weird things and her eyes suddenly become the eyes of a lizard with an eerie look in her face and blood in her mouth. Later, The Will manages to rescue Slave Girl with the help of Gwendolyn and Lying Cat.

Sophie

On board of The Will's spaceship, Slave Girl appears to be capable of hearing voices of objects. She says Gwendolyn's necklace would be sad and missing its old friends; finally hearing them again, not far away. The old friends appear to be the engagement rings that Gwendolyn gave Marko. Slave Girl then points into the direction of the rings.

In another daydream or hallucination, The Stalk is telling The Will to stop hunting down the robot, Prince Robot IV, that killed her and settle down with that Gwen chick, maybe adopt Slave Girl, and give the poor kid an actual name someday. Later when Gwendolyn tells The Will his yelling woke up Slave Girl, The Will says that's not her name, from now on they would call her Sophie.
name: Slave Girl

deck: Fard is a naked giant and triclops who is guarding a mysterious planetoid.
description:
Creation

Fard was created by Saga writer Brian K. Vaughan and artist Fiona Staples. Fard's first appearance was in Image Comics' Saga #7.

Major Story Arcs

After Marko's mother Klara banishes Hazel's babysitter Izabel, Marko and Klara teleport to the planetoid, where they suspect Izabel was banished to. But before they can find her, they make contact with Fard - a naked giant and triclops with ill-proportioned genitals. Fard looks so ugly that, when he first attacks Marko and Klara, Marko covers his mother eyes and tells her she doesn't really want to see but she responses it's got nothing she hasn't seen before. Klara wants to strike back but Marko can convince her to hit Fard with binding spell.

After the two bring Fard down, Marko tries to ask him about Izabel. Fard whispers he saw the little phantom wandering around Shadow City but they would never get there before the birth. Marko asks birth of what? Fard answers "of what is under your feet". Klara asks if he's saying there's something inside the planet? Fard is surprised and says this isn't a planet but an egg and the egg is almost ready to hatch.
name: Fard

deck: Mama Sun seems to run the sex business on Sextillion. One of her former prostitutes was a 6 year old girl who was later saved from sex labor by a bounty hunter named "The Will."
description:
Creation

Mama Sun was created by Saga writer Brian K. Vaughan and artist Fiona Staples. Mama Sun's first appearance was in Image Comics' Saga #5.
name: Mama Sun

deck: The Ruler of Equestria and Twilight Sparkle's mentor.
description:
History

Celestia and her sister Luna were the former users of the Elements of Harmony and had both been alive for a long time. They banished King Sombre for enslaving the crystal ponies by sealing him deep in the arctic. They sealed Discord for torturing pegasi, unicorns and earth ponies by using the Elements of Harmony. Celestia represented Generosity, Kindness, and Magic when she first used the Elements to defeat Discord.

Few years after Discord was sealed in stone, Luna became bitter and resentful of her sister and their subjects who played in the day but slept throughout the night. Soon the bitterness in Luna transformed her into Nightmare Moon who vowed to bring eternal night. Celestia and her sister fought one another in their castle until Nightmare Moon bested her. With no other choices left a tearful Celestia was forced to use the Elements of Harmony to banish her little sister to the moon for one thousand years. With her sister gone Celestia took on the responsibilities Luna had and eventually left the Elements of Harmony in her old home and went to Canterlot to begin anew. As the years went by she offered the Apple Family who visited her kingdom looking for a suitable place to settle down. An open area close to the Everfree Forest, which was later named Sweet Apple Acres. Sweet Apple Acres brought many ponies throughout the land close to the orchard bringing in more citizens that eventually the outskirts became Ponyville.

The Fall of Sunset Shimmer

Celestia began seeking young students to mentor with potent magical abilities. Eventually, she chooses a young mare named Sunset Shimmer. Sunset Shimmer was a prodigy at magic but was quite boastful and condescending toward others, despite Celestia's lessons about humility. Celestia shows her the "Crystal Mirror" to which Sunset Shimmer became obsessed with it. In her reflection, Sunset saw herself as an Alicorn that could rule Equestria and later something more in the mirror, to which Celestia guided her away from the mirror and told saying it was probably a trick. As the weeks went by Sunset Shimmer constantly asked about the mirror, but Celestia said she'll learn about the mirror when she is ready. However not listening to her teacher Sunset Shimmer began researching the mirror behind Celestia's back in the Dark Magic section of the library and learned the "Crystal Mirror" leads to a different dimension.

However, the librarian alerted Celestia of what Sunset Shimmer was doing. Sunset berates her teacher for hiding such magic from her and demands to be made a princess saying she deserves to stand beside Celestia as her equal or even better. Celestia refuses, saying that being a princess must be earned, and removes Sunset from her position as her student. She has her royal guards escort Sunset Shimmer out of the castle and hears her say "this is the biggest mistake you'll make in your entire life." To which Celestia says "one of many" while looking at the picture illustrating the day she banished her sister to the moon. As Celestia left the library, she discovered the room to the Crystal Mirror open and her guards unconscious. As they awoke, they told her Sunset Shimmer overpowered them and only jumped into the mirror. Celestia later has the mirror moved to her throne room, to remind her and so Sunset Shimmer might come back one day.

Creation/Character Evolution:

Princess Celestia is an alicorn pony and ruler of Equestria alongside her younger sister, Princess Luna. In addition to her responsibility to raise the sun, she also mentored Twilight Sparkle, whom she often referred to as "my most faithful student." She has a female pet phoenix named Philomena.

Princess Celestia was inspired by Majesty, a G1 Unicorn. The name of Celestia comes from the word "Celestial", derived from the Latin "Caelum", which means "sky" or "heavens". Lauren Faust commented that Princess Celestia was originally developed to be Queen Celestia, but her status was changed to "Princess" at Hasbro's request. Lauren Faust also mentioned that during the casting hearings (in the original version), Trixie's voice actor Kathleen Barr did very well during the tests for Princess Celestia until Nicole Oliver took over.

Celestia is larger than any other pony, except for Nightmare Moon, which is almost the same size, until she returns to be Princess Luna. As with the other unicorns, a magical glow surrounds their horn and the objects it is magically affecting. The color of this brightness varies: for example, blue in A Bird in the Hull, orange in The Cutie Mark Chronicles and white in The Queen of Jokes. In The Return of Harmony - Part 1, it's blue when Celestia opens the vault door, but pink when she levitates the empty box of Elements of Harmony that were supposed to be inside her. The brightness is yellow in the opening theme in Lesson Zero, as well as in the episode itself and in all episodes of the second season that follow. Its tail and mane have a natural flowing motion, even when Celestia is not moving.

Personality

She has a sweet tooth for cakes. She has many formalities, especially towards dealing with prophesied destinies, but despite this, she does love a good joke and feels bored living in Canterlot. Celestia is caring with all her subjects and truly desires the best for them.

She was like a mother figure for Twilight and always believed in her student's potential.

deck: Princess Celestia's little sister, who was once corrupted and became Nightmare Moon. Her sister sealed her in the moon for 1000 years until Twilight and her friends used the Elements of Harmony to restore her back to normal. Now she co-rules Equestria with Celestia.
description:
History

Luna is the younger sister of Celestia they both have lived for many years. Luna is the Princess of the Night and tasked with raising and lowering the moon. They both were the former users of the Elements of Harmony to which they used to seal Discord in a stone prison for torturing pegasi, unicorns and earth ponies with his powers over chaos. She represented the elements of Honesty, Laughter, and Loyalty when she originally wielded them. She and Celestia together banished King Sombra for enslaving the Crystal Ponies.

As the years went by Luna grew bitter and angry for her night being shunned by ponies that she refused to lower the moon. Soon her bitterness corrupted her and became "Nightmare Moon". Celestia was a force to use the Elements of Harmony to seal her sister in the moon for a thousand years. Nightmare Moon was freed from her prison on the longest day of the thousandth year during the "Summer Sun Celebration". She continued her plan for creating an everlasting night but was stopped by Twilight Sparkle, Applejack, Fluttershy, Pinkie Pie, Rarity, and Rainbow Dash who used the Elements of Harmony to heal her. After returning to normal, she made amends with her sister and accepted ruling Equestria together.

Due to her being sealed 1000 years she is still adapting to modern customs and still feels discouraged for not being appreciated and still being feared for her time as Nightmare Moon. She has learned to talk softly instead of using the "Royal Canterlot Voice" from Fluttershy and also learned to have fun from Applejack. She has accepted her holiday "Nightmare Night" as what it is and that children enjoy the holiday.

Creation/Character Evolution:

The word "Luna" means "Moon" in Italian and Spanish (in both cases, derived from Latin). The title of the book Twilight Sparkle reads in "Friendship is Magic, Part 1, "The Mare on the Moon," is a joke with the mythical story of man on the moon. According to Lauren Faust, Nightmare Moon was originally called "Discord", a name that would be given to another villain.

The appearance of Princess Luna changed after the first episode. Her body is a shade of darker blue, her mane is partially translucent, undulating, and radiant as Celestia's. Its ancient design is still used in the online game Canterlot Castle, and its old mane is partially visible in some scenes of "Luna Eclipsed". Lauren Faust stated that when Luna is fully grown she does not look like Nightmare Moon. She also stated that when Nightmare Moon was defeated, Luna was reborn with very low levels of magic. In more recent episodes, her mane was magical and undulating again because her good powers had been restored.

A pony based on Luna's design is used in Simplicity and Elite. One of the show's layout artists suggested Luna's height and slim body may have been used to give the pony a supermodel appearance.

Occupation

Although she is in charge of the moon, she is also able to enter and monitor the dreams of ponies as this is part of being Princess of the Night. Only Luna possesses the ability to enter inside the dreams, but it should be noted that Celestia can also lower the moon and was doing such thing when Luna was still imprisoned.

Personality

She still has mannerism from a thousand years ago that is learning to develop to the time. She prefers being in the heat of action but will listen to her older sister sometimes. Luna is always willing to help and this can be seen very well when the same helped the Cutie Mark Crusaders in the past during many occasions. Once transformed from Nightmare Moon back to its former form, Princess Luna was sorry and rushes to the side of Celestia, apologizing for what she has done. The two sisters later join the celebration at Ponyville where Luna receives a welcome wreath and looks at her sister with a smile.

Abilities

Princess Luna is an Alicorn with a vast amount of magical powers who can raise and lower the moon with her magic. Despite this, she is capable of controlling the weather and is capable of shapeshifting. Her unique ability is to enter other ponies dreams. Sometimes she will assist those having nightmares like when Scootaloo was having nightmares. She also visited Sweetie Belle and showed her the consequences of her actions by showing her the past, present, and future in her dreams.

deck: Dante is the main villain in the Last Man Standing Universe.
description:
Dante is modified human, the leader of the terrorist group PANDEMONIUM and the main antagonist of the series. He was kept in the level-9 facility before breaking out during his 7th year of incarceration.

Powers and Abilities

Dante was the first super-soldier created this project later became the Paladin Project. Due to his Armtech upgrades Dante possess superhuman level attributes, the limits of which have not been ascertained however he has been confirmed to have killed 9 Paladin's (the same type of super soldiers as Gabriel) so he is indeed a fierce opponent. He also has an incredible healing factor. Dante was seen walking through machine gun-fire even taking shots to the head with absolutely no effect or signs of discomfort. Dante is an expert hand to hand and close quarter fighter, in his diary Gabriel said that anything Dante could lay his hands on could be turned into a deadly weapon even seemingly harmless objects.

Dante also possesses an enhanced brain which allows him to run through nearly every possible combat scenario granting him an incredible tactical advantage.
name: Dante

deck: A fighter from the West Galaxy, Pikkon is the greatest student of the West Kai and a rival for Goku.
description:
History

Not much is known about Pikkon's past, besides how long he has been training in the otherworld.

Pikkon was once a fighter who lived in an unknown location in the West Quadrant of the universe. After dying a heroic death, Pikkon was permitted to journey to the planet of West Kai, where he trained hard and became West Kai's best student.

Pikkon is a very wise and adept fighter. He uses this to his advantage by planning out attacks. Pikkon even goes as far to correct Goku on his "sloppy" dodging and inability to concentrate, offering advice even in battle. When he first appears, he hardly speaks a word, but later opens up during his bout against Goku. Pikkon has heroic characteristics similar to Goku's, is a being of honor and valor. Goku compares his personality to that of Piccolo, and even states that Pikkon and Piccolo would "get along great"

Powers

Pikkon is the strongest warrior from the West Galaxy and is superior in strength, speed, and endurance to Goku in his Super Saiyan form. He is able to withstand Goku's Super Kaio-ken technique and quickly recover. He takes down Frieza and King Cold each with one blow, and manages to catch Perfect Cell off-guard as well with his tremendous speed. Pikkon has mastered powerful techniques, including the Burning Shoot, which is similar to Goku's Kaio-ken in that it provides a brief but incredible boost of energy, speed, and strength.

Techniques and special abilities:

Flight – Like most characters, Pikkon has the ability to fly using his ki.

Ki Blast – The most basic form of energy wave.

Quick Rush - Pikkon's signature attack in Raging Blast 2.

Kiai – Pikkon blows an invisible wave of ki through his mouth. He used it to dispel Olibu's Chasing Energy Ball.

Homing Energy Wave – A move where Pikkon fires a Ki Blast that targets his enemy. He used it against Goku in the episode "Final Round".

Continuous Energy Bullets – Rapid Fire Energy pulses .

Final Flash – An energy wave attack used on Goku after hitting his Thunder Flash Attack.

Nova Strike – Pikkon used an attack similar to Frieza's Nova Strike in a Beam Struggle against Super Saiyan Goku in the episode "Goku vs. Pikkon". He surrounds his body in a blue sphere of energy and charges at the opponent using the blue sphere as a shield.

Hyper Tornado – Pikkon starts spinning at high speeds, drills towards his opponent, then entraps them in a powerful tornado.

Burning Shoot – Pikkon surrounds himself in fire and attacks the opponent continuously. This attack was used to defeat Cell in the Other World.

Blazing Zephyr – The combination of two types of kick which he used on Super Saiyan Goku.

No Running – A rush attack finished with the Trap Shooter. Used against Super Janemba.

Thunder Flash Attack – Pikkon shoots an immense storm of flames from his fists, his most powerful attack. Pikkon cannot move when he is using this technique.
name: Pikkon

deck: Former KGB operative known as the Crimson Dynamo and Airstrike.
description:
Bukharin is perhaps the most infamous of the Dynamos. He is a former KGB operative who was assigned the task of assisting the Soviet Super Soldiers in apprehending Magneto after a chunk of Asteroid M crashed to Earth. He provoked a fight with the X-Men and Avengers (the Avengers wanted to arrest Magneto, while the X-Men wanted to protect him). The Dynamo destroyed a cargo ship that Magneto had taken refuge on; he would have been convicted of the murder of the entire crew had the Soviet Super Soldiers, X-Men and Avengers not been present to save them. Afterwards, he was removed from the Soviet Super Soldiers.

Bukharin was the current Dynamo when Iron Man attempted to neutralize all armor wearers who utilized his stolen technology.

Bukharin, in a less sophisticated armor, joined Russia's new premiere team of heroes, the Supreme Soviets. He was ordered to attack the defecting Soviet Super Soldiers.

Bukharin was later relieved of the armor after he caused an international incident, retrieving the original Titanium Man from the United States. He was given a new armor and asked to rejoin the Supreme Soviets as Airstrike. Bukharin has recently been sighted by War Machine and Tony Stark, in his original Crimson Dynamo armor. He lent it to Stark, who needed a less sophisticated armor than his own. Bukharin now serves as the liaison between the Winter Guard and the Russian Executive Security Committee; after the recent Dire Wraith invasion of Russia, he serves the Crimson Dynamo program.

Current status: alive

Origin

Owen Backes' powers first manifested during a car accident. He survived, but his girlfriend didn't. Afraid and confused, the police started shooting at him until the X-Men arrived in order to help him and offer him a place at the Jean Grey School for Higher Learning, but then a newly reassembled Freedom Force arrived to take him instead.

After a quick battle between the two teams, Owen chose to go with Freedom Force in order to help his country, with everyone unaware that Kade Kilgore intended to take Owen for his own purposes with the use of his relations in the US government.

deck: Psychotic villain who can move 'stingers' over any point of his body.
description:
A villain and member of U.N.I.C.O.R.N. Yellow Jacket first encountered Critter after she first joined The Core. Operating with Rookie, Critter almost took Yellow Jacket down. However, he traded as many bruises as he gave, cutting Critters shoulder open and eventually hospitalizing her, despite her and Rookie defeating him.

In the excitement of getting Critter to a hospital, Yellow Jacket seemingly got away.

While the rest of The Core were fighting against the Ampibodons controlled by Tidepool, Icon and Starlette confronted Yellow Jacket and his agents of U.N.I.C.O.R.N., they were held back by Cricket until Rookie managed to disrupt her powers allowing the rest of the group to defeat the villain group.
name: Yellow Jacket

deck: A character from Optic Nerve.
description:
Origin

Sam is a character in issue six of the Drawn & Quarterly series, Optic Nerve.

Creation

Sam was created by Adrian Tomine.

Character Evolution

Sam meets Hillary Chan while she is making prank phone calls. He becomes interested in her because he likes her voice, and when the prank she pulls on him falls flat, he tries to find out where she is. Hillary is reluctant at first, and tells him to call back another time. After their initial conversation, Sam returns to the pay phone where he spoke to Hillary, and attempts to speak to her again. This time, he tells her that if she does not reveal her location, her will hang up and walk away. He reasons that she has the advantage, since she already knows where he is. When she agrees, and tells Sam which window is hers, he invites her down for a drink - and she accepts.

Sam appears to be quite taken with Hillary. On their first date, she tells him he should get out while he still can. He reassures her that it is alright, he understands she has problems and prefers people that way, as it provides a distraction from the troubles in his own life. The couple end up going back to Sam's place and sleeping together, and after spending the night with each other, Hillary asks Sam if he will go with her to her grandmother's funeral.

Major Story Arcs

Sam does not appear in any major story arcs.

Powers And Abilities

Sam is a human character with no special powers or abilities.
name: Sam
